skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
If you've got the Warptokens and the contacts, you can get all manner of fine, murderous armaments crafted to fit claw or tail perfectly.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through their mastery of forgecraft, Clan Ferrik's alchemists and Forgemasters have uncovered techniques to disrupt the integrity of enemy armor, rendering even the finest Dwarven plate vulnerable. With a hiss of molten warp-oil and corrosive fumes, the mightiest defenses crumble under Skaven ingenuity.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Stormvermin units
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Ingenious Skaven engineering—or stolen Dwarven designs—these overlapping plates provide unmatched protection and stability for Ferrik’s elite warriors, ensuring their lines never break.

effects.description:
Ability: "Interlocking Plates" for Clan Ferrik Elite units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Fueled by gromril and absolute ambition, the presence of Clan Ferrik's unyielding warlord inspires the army to fight with frenzied devotion, ignoring pain and fear alike.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Through their mastery of forgecraft, Clan Ferrik's alchemists and Forgemasters have uncovered techniques to disrupt the integrity of enemy armor, rendering even the finest Dwarven plate vulnerable. With a hiss of molten warp-oil and corrosive fumes, the mightiest defenses crumble under Skaven ingenuity.
Enslaved Dawi laborers toil endlessly under the whips of their Skaven masters, their begrudging craftsmanship turning the forges of Clan Ferrik into unparalleled engines of war.

Infused with unholy energies and the stolen strength of Dwarven gromril, this barbaric creation is the pinnacle of Clan Ferrik craftmanship, imbuing weapons forged in this manner an ethereal sharpness and eldritch glow. Naturally, Iron Mask only trusts those rats closest to him with such a dangerous forging.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing missile damage: +4
	(all units in army)

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Deep within the shadowed caverns of the Worlds Edge Mountains, Clan Ferrik festers with an undying hatred for the Dwarves, born from centuries of bloodshed and humiliation. Every forge taken from the hands of the proud Zhufbar clans fuels their obsession with dominance, their molten crucibles overflowing with iron twisted into symbols of Skaven supremacy. To Clan Ferrik, each strike of their war hammers against captured Dawi steel is not just crafting - it is vengeance, reshaping the legacy of their foes into implements of their own annihilation. Guided by their masked and tyrannical warlord, the Skaven of Clan Ferrik will stop at nothing to see every Dwarf stronghold crumble into ruin and their forges forever silenced.

effects.description: Beneath the Mountain: Should Clan Ferrik capture the forges of Zhufbar, they will unlock access to unique units crafted in those fiery environs.
Plundered Forge: Many captured Dawi labour in the forges of Clan Ferrik, forced to create the items they would do were they at home in their hold. And some that no Dawi would ever wish to forge.
Armour +5 and Weapon Strength +3% for Clan Ferrik for each active war against Dwarfs & Chaos Dwarfs
Masters of the Warren: Clan Ferrik’s armies navigate the Underway with unparalleled efficiency, gaining increased movement range in subterranean environments.

items.colour_text: "Hah, you ask-squeak of the mask, yes-yes? It was mine-earned the day I struck down-crushed the last fool who dared lead-call himself master of Ferrik. His words weak-soft, his steel dull-rusted, and in the final clash-clang of our duel, his blood painted my blade red-bright! When I took-tore the mask from his lifeless face, it burned-stung my hands, whispering promises of power-command. Now it binds to me, strong-tight, makes me unkillable, yes-yes—Ferrik’s true ruler, forever-ever!"

ui_effects.localised_text: Chance of unit gaining hit points

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Iron Mask has declared eternal war on the Dwarfs of Zhufbar, vowing to turn their holds into forges that will fuel his ever-expanding war machine. Beneath his iron gaze, Clan Ferrik has become the Under-Empire’s preeminent supplier of steel and weapons, all while pushing the bounds of Skaven ingenuity, cruelty, and ambition.

effects.description:
Ability: "Feral Rage I" for enemy Dwarf and Chaos Dwarf units
	(enemy armies in local province)

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

effects.description:

	(enemy armies in local province)

attributes.bullet_text:

	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

	(Lord's army)
